11.title: The Little Hitch-Hiker
11.author: by Gene Ahern
11.appears_in: reproduced on p. 380 of The Comic Strip Century (Northampton, MA : Kitchen Sink Press, 1995)
notes: Summary: A man sent out to find out what the Little Hitch-Hiker is saying comes back saying 'Nov shmoz ka pop?' himself.

12.title: The Little Hitch-Hiker
12.author: by Gene Ahern
12.series: Oct. 24, 1937) "Prof. Svengali will Hypnotize the Little Hitch-Hiker into Going to some Other Location"*
12.appears_in: reproduced on p. 380 of The Comic Strip Century (Northampton, MA : Kitchen Sink Press, 1995)
notes: Summary: Svengali convinces an ostrich that it's an Airedale, but fails to connect with the Little Hitch-Hiker, who then takes a nap while the hypnotized professor says 'Nov shmoz ka pop?'

13.title: The Little Hitch-Hiker
13.author: Gene Ahern

notes: Summary: The Little Hitch-Hiker is undeterred by the new fence, and draws himself a train.

16.title: The Little Hitch-Hiker

17.title: The Little Hitch-Hiker

40.heading: Little Jesus.
40.title: "The Lord of Donkeys" p. 24-37 in The Three Ears
40.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky - Georges Bess ; translation by Justin Kelly.
notes: (The White Lama ; 3)

Summary: The feeble-minded Little Jesus, with the power of Lama Migmar behind him, rules the monastery with his whims. He has decided that a donkey should lead them in prayer, for example. Topden shows Gabriel this humiliation, and also the quarters of the "disciplinary monks," where acts of drunken cruelty are proceeding. He sees that senior lamas who object are being entombed alive. In the library, Chinese workers are excavating, searching for a fabled treasure. Topden and Gabriel are discovered as they watch the excavation. Topden is caught, but Tzu rescues Gabriel.

41.heading: Little Jesus.
41.title: "Trial and Miracles" p. 3-12 in The Three Ears
41.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky - Georges Bess ; translation by Justin Kelly.
notes: (The White Lama ; 3)

Summary: Gabriel Marpa arrives at the monastery and is made to sit motionless in the courtyard for three hot days and three freezing nights. Snails come to cover and cool him in the day, and a blanket blows his way in the night. Little Jesus is shown eating pork, though the eating of animals is supposed to be forbidden.
